PARAGRAPH.STRING: , also spelled Kazakstan or Khazakhstan, (Kazakh: Қазақстан, Qazaqstan, IPA [IPA: [qɑzɑqˈstɑn]]; Russian: Казахстан, Kazakhstán, IPA [IPA: [kəzʌxˈstan]]), officially the Republic of Kazakhstan, is a country that stretches over a vast expanse of northern and central Eurasia. A small portion of
territory west of the Ural River is located in eastern-most Europe.
has borders with Russia, the People's Republic of China, and the Central Asian countries Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan, and
has a coastline on the Caspian Sea.
was a republic of the former Soviet Union and
is now a member of the Commonwealth of Independent States.
is the ninth-largest country in the world by area, but

is only 62nd country in population, with approximately 6 persons per km² (15 per sq. mi.). Population in 2006 is estimated at 15,300,000, down from 16,464,464 in 1989 due to the emigration of ethnic Russians and Volga Germans. Much of
